objective: Promote earlier payments from customers to improve incoming cashflow.

strategies.description: Offer a small percentage discount (e.g., 2%) if the customer pays within a short timeframe (e.g., 10 days).
strategies.impact: Reduces revenue slightly but accelerates cash inflow.

strategies.description: Allow customer to pay in installments, but require an initial upfront payment.
strategies.impact: Ensures partial cash inflow early while maintaining flexibility for customer.

strategies.description: Sell unpaid invoices to a factoring company for immediate cash.
strategies.impact: Immediate liquidity with a fee; reduces accounts receivable.

strategies.description: Automate invoice reminders and provide easy payment methods (ACH, credit card).
strategies.impact: Reduces delays caused by manual follow-ups and friction in payment process.

strategies.description: Convert one-time billing into recurring or upfront retainer payments.
strategies.impact: Predictable and regular cash inflows; shifts payment earlier in cycle.

strategies.description: Assess customer payment behavior and offer shorter terms to reliable payers.
strategies.impact: Reduces late payments and improves payment predictability.
